articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: At Bitcoin 2023, Kennedy called Bitcoin a bulwark against government and corporate intrusion.
articles.title: Presidential Candidate Kennedy Vows to Defend Bitcoin Against ‘Invasive Surveillance’

articles.author: Pedro Solimano
articles.description: The “Phygital” toy collection brings in half a million dollars in sales in two days.
articles.title: Pudgy Penguins Smash Amazon Debut, Sells Over 20,000 Toys

articles.author: Tim Hakki
articles.description: For the third week running, the prices of most leading cryptocurrencies didn’t move much.
articles.title: This Week in Coins: SEC and CBDC News Drives XRP Rally During Slow Week

articles.author: Andrew Hayward
articles.description: With VeeCon 2023 underway, Gary Vaynerchuk joins Decrypt to discuss the rise of AI and his take on the volatile NFT market.
articles.title: Gary Vee Is Hyped About AI—And Expands VeeCon Beyond NFTs

articles.description: During VeeCon 2023, entrepreneur spoke with Decrypt's Andrew Hayward about the rise of AI tools, what excites him about the technology, and what kind of impact he thinks it will have on creators and business.
articles.title: Gary Vee Discusses the Rise and Impact of AI

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Ordinals hype has spread from Bitcoin to both Dogecoin and Litecoin, driving network activity on all three chains to recent all-time peaks.
articles.title: Meme Tokens and NFTs Took Over Bitcoin—Now It's Happening on Dogecoin and Litecoin

articles.author: Liam J. Kelly
articles.description: Liquid staking protocol Lido Finance is looking to add a bit more utility to what is just a simple voting token. Here's how LDO could change.
articles.title: DeFi Heavyweight Lido Finance Mulls LDO Staking, Token Buyback

articles.author: Jason Nelson
articles.description: Tech giant Apple reportedly restricted internal use of the AI chatbot over data leak concerns, joining Samsung and other corporate giants.
articles.title: Apple Bans Employees From Using ChatGPT Over AI Privacy Fears: WSJ

articles.author: André Beganski
articles.description: RFK Jr. is deep down the Bitcoin rabbit hole—and it was the vaccine-mandate protests in Canada that got him started down the path.
articles.title: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. Says COVID Protests Led Him to Bitcoin

articles.author: Jose Antonio Lanz
articles.description: Can ChatGPT help you find your significant other? Some guys are definitely scoring.
articles.title: Meet the Dudes Using AI Chatbots to Get Real Dates

articles.description: VeeCon is back in 2023, moving from Minneapolis to Indianapolis, and creator and entrepreneur Gary Vaynerchuk joined Decrypt's Andrew Hayward to discuss his aim to make it the "coolest business conference in the world." And that means expanding the focus beyond NFTs and Web3 to include AI and other tech innovations, along with broader business and pop culture content.
articles.title: Gary Vee Discusses VeeCon 2023's Broader Shift Beyond Web3

articles.description: Gary Vaynerchuk called the NFT market decline back in 2021, but the owner of CryptoPunks and other valuable tokenized assets still believes that a sustainable market will eventually form. He joins Decrypt's Andrew Hayward amid VeeCon 2023 to discuss why he thinks the NFT space will be comparable to collectible sports cards, art, and even stuffed animals.
articles.title: Gary Vee on the NFT Market and Why 'NFTs Are Stuffed Animals'

articles.description: Immutable VP & Gods Unchained Game Director Chris Clay tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about what it's like to work in the game industry for decades and why he's not giving up on NFT games.
articles.title: What Immutable's Chris Clay Learned in 23 Years of Game Development

articles.author: Mathew Di Salvo
articles.description: A Las Vegas man has been hit with new charges as part of the CoinDeal crypto and metaverse alleged scam—and could face up to 100 years behind bars.
articles.title: Las Vegas Man Charged in CoinDeal $45M Crypto Fraud Case

articles.author: Pedro Solimano
articles.description: Crypto legislation has been hard to work on due to "fear that Bitcoin and cryptocurrencies are being used for criminal activities,” Lummis said.
articles.title: Biden's 30% Tax on Bitcoin Miners 'Isn't Going to Happen,' Says Cynthia Lummis

articles.description: The team behind Swaprum appears to have disappeared with $3 million in customer funds.
articles.title: Another CertiK Audited Project Rugs as $3M Disappears From Arbitrum DeFi Exchange

articles.description: Crypto startup Keyp is creating an offline crypto storage solution with a Game Boy cartridge that gamifies the seed phrase process.
articles.title: Your Old Game Boy Can Now Be Turned Into a Bitcoin and Ethereum Hardware Wallet

articles.description: The Ethereum project just launched Streamingfellaz, letting NFT holders appear as their zombified avatars on streams and video calls.

articles.description: The total value locked in smart contracts using the Ethereum Layer-2 scaling solution has just hit an all-time high of over $10 million.

articles.title: 'So Much Anger, So Much Hate', Says Ledger Co-Founder Amid Botched Recover Service Launch

articles.description: Web3 startup Gala Games said that it has virtually depleted its own treasury to alleviate concerns of a future token selloff.
articles.title: Gala Games Burns Over $600 Million Worth of GALA Tokens

articles.title: Adidas Web3 Lead Thought She ‘Could Get Fired’ for Signing Bored Ape Deal

articles.description: BitBox, Cold Card, Trezor and Blockstream all announced sale prices on their cold storage devices.
articles.title: Seizing Upon Ledger Stumble, Hardware Wallet Competitors Offer Discounts

articles.description: Solana Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the current state of Solana's Web3 gaming ecosystem.
articles.title: How Many Games Are Building On Solana? The Answer Might Surprise You

articles.description: InfiniGods Cofounders Owen O'Donoghue and Damon Gura keep it real with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, sharing thoughts on game balancing and what to do when in-game assets become NFTs.
articles.title: Problems With Being an 'On-Chain Purist'  in Gaming

articles.description: Solana Foundation's Games General Manager Johnny Lee tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Solana's "build together" approach as well as his thoughts on crypto firms becoming game publishers.
articles.title: Why Solana Won't Become A Web3 Game Publisher

articles.description: Hedera VP Alex Russman tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about Hedera's Web3 gaming ecosystem and shares a game he's particularly excited about.
articles.title: The State Of Web3 Gaming On Hedera

articles.description: Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games Cofounder Michael McCarthy tells Decrypt's Kate Irwin about the game's thoughtful approach to audio design and the technologies being built to support the MMORPG's immersive world.
articles.title: How Mirandus is Innovating Video Game Audio

articles.description: Decrypt's Kate Irwin asks the InfiniGods developers Damon Gura and Owen O’Donoghue about gamers and NFTs.
articles.title: Do Gamers Hate NFTs?

articles.description: Avenged Sevenfold lead singer Matt Sanders, aka M. Shadows, is rehearsing for the band's upcoming tour. He's also figuring out how to upend what it means to be a music fan. The band launched a Deathbats Club NFT collection in 2021. That is to say: They were early. The lead singer said it was timed to give fans a chance to get comfortable with Web3 technology ahead of the group's 2023 tour, when the NFT holders can use their Deathbats for early access to tickets. M. Shadows also talked to hosts Andrew Hayward and Stephen Graves about AI and bringing Web3 into gaming.
articles.title: gm: Avenged Sevenfold's M. Shadows on Deathbats, Fandom, and AI

articles.description: At the Game Developers' Conference, Mojo Melee Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella tell Decrypt's Kate Irwin about their autobattler game and its unique characters, which are also NFTs on Polygon.
articles.title: Inside Mojo Melee's Lore with Creator Mike Levine and Art Director Eric Campanella

articles.description: "The Blair Witch Project" Executive Producer Kevin Foxe wants to avoid corporate overlords and enlighten fans of the dark "Mandala" graphic novel with a video game adaptation and NFTs across multiple blockchains.
articles.title: Why 'Blair Witch' Exec Producer Kevin Foxe Is '1,000% In' on Gaming

articles.description: "When assets are overdone, they just feel a little dirty. It's not pretty to look at," shared Mirandus' Lead Developer and Gala Games co-founder Michael McCarthy in an interview with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.
articles.title: Gala Games Co-Founder on the Aesthetic of Mirandus

articles.description: Solana Games' General Manager Johnny Lee offers a hot take on the first generation of Web3 gaming with Decrypt's Kate Irwin.
articles.title: Solana Games GM: Play-to-Earn Games Are DeFi Products, Not Games

articles.description: XSET's Brycent shares his advice for Web3 content creators with Decrypt's Kate Irwin, including which social media platform is best for posting content.
articles.title: Brycent's Advice For Gaming Content Creators

articles.description: A look at the preparation behind "Auras," an event in which photographer Jeremy Cowart produced and starred in 10,000 photo-based NFTs, captured in less than 30 minutes before a live audience. Credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt
articles.title: Behind the Scenes of Jeremy Cowart's 'Auras' NFT Event

articles.description: Jeremy Cowart speaks with Decrypt's Sander Lutz in Nashville ahead of the "Auras" event, in which the noted photographer live-shot 10,000 unique photo-based NFTs in less than 30 minutes. The NFTs will be released through OpenSea on May 9. Video credit: Brett Carlsen for Decrypt
articles.title: Jeremy Cowart Discusses 'Auras' Event, Live-Shooting 10,000 Photo NFTs

articles.description: "The Web3 interfaces cannot be on the foreground of the player's initial experience," says Azra Games CEO Mark Otero.
articles.title: Azra Games CEO on Putting Fun Before Web3
